name: CodePipelineCustomActionTypeConfigurationProperties
description: ConfigurationProperties is a property of the AWS::CodePipeline::CustomActionType resource that defines a configuration for an AWS CodePipeline custom action.

properties.name: Description
properties.description: A description of this configuration property that will be displayed to users.

properties.name: Key
properties.description: Indicates whether the configuration property is a key.

properties.name: Name
properties.description: A name for this configuration property.

properties.name: Queryable
properties.description: Indicates whether the configuration property will be used with the PollForJobs call. A custom action can have one queryable property. The queryable property must be required (see the Required property) and must not be secret (see the Secret property). For more information, see the queryable contents for the ActionConfigurationProperty data type in the AWS CodePipeline API Reference.

properties.name: Required
properties.description: Indicates whether the configuration property is a required value.

properties.name: Secret
properties.description: Indicates whether the configuration property is secret. Secret configuration properties are hidden from all AWS CodePipeline calls except for GetJobDetails, GetThirdPartyJobDetails, PollForJobs, and PollForThirdPartyJobs.

properties.name: Type
properties.description: The type of the configuration property, such as String, Number, or Boolean.
